Description: Limestone ostracon; ink smudges on one side. Remains of 11 lines on recto and traces on verso (Palimpsest?) containing a delcaration/oath.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Monastery of St Phoibammon, Location of the Temple of Mentuhotep I.
Bibliographic references: Biedenkopf-Ziehner 2000a / Koptische Ostraka I: Ostraka aus dem Britischen Museum in London (109-112, pl.6)
Naville 1907-1913 / The XIth Dynasty Temple at Deir el-Bahari (3:20) (ed. by H R Hall)
Delattre 2002 / CR de O.Brit.Mus.Copt. II et O.Ashm.Copt. (331-33)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82872) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82872)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Jacob (son of Pesynthios)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. II 6 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
